avalancheActivity.comment: A size 2 avalanche fell in Eldborgargil in Bláfjöll on the 26.3. during E winds with snowdrift. Small avalanches are widely seen where snow has drifted.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Quite a lot of snow was added on Thursday evening. Windslabs were formed in strong NE-winds during the weekend

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs have formed widely in westerly aspects after snowfall and ongoing E- and NE-winds lately. Older snowpack is widely frozen and stiff but faceting was discovered in a weak layer in snowpits on the 26th of March. High load is required in order to trigger an avalanche on this layer.

travelAdvisory.comment: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-læg átt og él en rignir á láglendi á fimmtud.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few avalanches in the area during Easter.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in NE-N snowdrift. Weak layers exist in the snowpack, even though most places they don´t seem very touchy.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has been added in three storms, in mid March, during Easter and on and after last weekend. Snowdrift in NE and N winds. There has not been any thaw, so thick wind slabs have formed in gullies and leesides of mountains. They are considered rather stable in most places, but if avalanches would release they might become large. People travelling in steep slopes and gullies might trigger avalanches, especially where the weaknesses are shallow, i.e. in convex landscape features and around cliffs or rocks.

travelAdvisory.comment: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-átt og snjókoma og skafrenningur á fimmtudag og föstudag. Hægur vindur, úrkomulaust og kalt á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: 10.April: Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2, elev: 600 m, aspect: SSE) in Bæjarfjall. 9.April Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2.5, elev: 600 m, aspect: S) in Bæjarfjall. Many human triggered avalanches were released the days after the Easter-snowstorm and many big natural slab avalanches occured during the snowstorm. A rather large avalanche released in Héðinsfjarðardalur on March 26th, likely triggered by snowmobiles with remote triggering indicates a pwl
avalancheActivity.highlights: Skier triggered slabs 9th and 10th of april. Persistant weaklayer still present in snowpits. Widespread layered windslabs on most aspects after repeated storm cycles with heavy snow accumulation some places.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The third NE-snowstorm last Sunday-Monday were adding to present windslabs which started to form the week before Easter. Snowpits near Siglufjörður show thin windslab on top of thick old windslab and a weakness within the new windslab in on snowpit. Snowpits near Dalvík showed rather stable snow but still some small slabs have released in the area today and yesterday. Persistant weakness is likely still present on the border between the windslabs and the firn below, deep in the snowpack. Therefore a risk for big avalanches from that layer if triggered.

travelAdvisory.comment: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt á miðvikudag en vaxandi austanátt með snjókomu og skafrennigi til fjalla á fimmtudag. Stíf NA-átt og él eða samfeld snjókoma á föstudag. Hægbreytileg átt og þurrt á laugardag

avalancheActivity.comment: A rather large slab avalanche released in Harðskafi above Eskifjörður during the NE storm. Wide slab released in northern part of Mjóifjörður. During Easter, multiple slab avalanches released around Eskifjörður, some of them large, and smaller slabs released in Seyðisfjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow high in mountains and inland after a NE snowstorm during the weekend. People should be careful in the first few days after the storm, due to increased chance of triggering avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The NE storm during the weekend added more snow on top of layered wind slabs that formed in NE snow showers Easter. Snow has accumulated snow in leesides of mountains, gullies and depressions, especially above 4-500 m altitude. Lower in slopes, there is less snow. Weaknesses can be expected between differently hard wind slabs, and a deep persistent weakness has been found in older snow at high elevations. Natural avalanches unlikely but people travelling in steep slopes and gullies could trigger an avalanche.

travelAdvisory.comment: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-átt og snjókoma á fimmtudag en rigning á láglendi. Hægari vindur á föstudag, smá él á föstudagskvöld. Kólnar á laugardag.
